channel.title: Insert Credit Show
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Hot Button Podcast.
channel.itunes:author: Insert Credit
channel.itunes:summary: A relentlessly on topic smorgasbord of hard hittin' video game questions as addressed by a panel of experts. Featuring Frank Cifaldi, Tim Rogers, Brandon Sheffield. Hosted by Alex Jaffe. Edited by Blaine Brown.
channel.description: A relentlessly on topic smorgasbord of hard hittin' video game questions as addressed by a panel of experts. Featuring Frank Cifaldi, Tim Rogers, Brandon Sheffield. Hosted by Alex Jaffe. Edited by Blaine Brown.

item.title: Ep. 1 - Happy Birthday, Charles Manson
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebrating the 25th anniversary of Metal Gear.
item.itunes:summary: This week frank cifaldi, tim rogers, and brandon sheffield join us to discuss Hideo Kojima, how to make MMOs fun, and skellingtons.
item.description: This week frank cifaldi, tim rogers, and brandon sheffield join us to discuss Hideo Kojima, how to make MMOs fun, and skellingtons.

item.title: Ep. 2 - Citizen Bonk
item.itunes:subtitle: The IC cast goes loopy over free slurpees.
item.itunes:summary: frank cifaldi, tim rogers, and brandon sheffield once again join us to discuss kickstarter, the history of achievements, and the meltdown of 38 Studios.
item.description: frank cifaldi, tim rogers, and brandon sheffield once again join us to discuss kickstarter, the history of achievements, and the meltdown of 38 Studios.

item.title: Ep. 3 - Shagargamel
item.itunes:subtitle: Come in if you want to get naughty
item.itunes:summary: Is your body ready for one full hour of frank, tim, and brandon discussing time as a game design mechanic, the value of the PlayStation Vita, and how to explain Hyperdimension Neptunia to your mom? Because if so then oh man do we have a treat for you!
item.description: Is your body ready for one full hour of frank, tim, and brandon discussing time as a game design mechanic, the value of the PlayStation Vita, and how to explain Hyperdimension Neptunia to your mom? Because if so then oh man do we have a treat for you!

item.title: Ep. 4 - Dr. Pepper Hot Dog Cafe
item.itunes:subtitle: A spoiler-free walkthrough
item.itunes:summary: Those Three Guys (tim, brandon, frank) return for a fourth helping of no-nonsense questioneering. Join us for a hearty discussion of Metacritic, Monster World, and mouse livers.
item.description: Those Three Guys (tim, brandon, frank) return for a fourth helping of no-nonsense questioneering. Join us for a hearty discussion of Metacritic, Monster World, and mouse livers.

item.title: Ep. 5 - Tactical Freakout with Shawn McGrath
item.itunes:subtitle: Bringing the suck with two cores.
item.itunes:summary: This week the Insert Credit gang is joined by Dyad creator Shawn McGrath to discuss weapon design, NPC dialogue, and the rigidity of Johnny Wadd.
item.description: This week the Insert Credit gang is joined by Dyad creator Shawn McGrath to discuss weapon design, NPC dialogue, and the rigidity of Johnny Wadd.

item.title: Ep. 6 - Seattle Rhythm with Christian Nutt
item.itunes:subtitle: Have a good time
item.itunes:summary: Fresh off his article on The Bouncer, Christian Nutt joins the gang to discuss unkept Fable promises, using the -san suffix in English writing, and Charizard.
item.description: Fresh off his article on The Bouncer, Christian Nutt joins the gang to discuss unkept Fable promises, using the -san suffix in English writing, and Charizard.

item.title: Ep. 7 - Gamer Grub with Patrick Miller
item.itunes:subtitle: Press A to Mario
item.itunes:summary: Insert Credit regular Patrick Miller joins us to talk about Gamescom, players of video games, and warthog drifting.
item.description: Insert Credit regular Patrick Miller joins us to talk about Gamescom, players of video games, and warthog drifting.

item.title: Ep. 8 - Panza Vision with Vito Gesualdi
item.itunes:subtitle: Thanks for listening, mom
item.itunes:summary: Hollywood Correspondent Vito Gesualdi pops in to talk about Nintendo Power, Turbo Play, and MAD Magazine.
item.description: Hollywood Correspondent Vito Gesualdi pops in to talk about Nintendo Power, Turbo Play, and MAD Magazine.

item.title: Ep. 9 - Al Pacino's Vegas Adventure
item.itunes:subtitle: Our in-depth review of 3D-Day 3.
item.itunes:summary: Action Button Entertainment art director Brent Porter hangs out for some real talk about BioWare, escort missions, and how to make D-Day interesting again.
item.description: Action Button Entertainment art director Brent Porter hangs out for some real talk about BioWare, escort missions, and how to make D-Day interesting again.

item.title: Ep. 10 - My Neighbor Totilo
item.itunes:subtitle: Downhill Jam!
item.itunes:summary: Kotaku editor-in-chief Stephen Totilo debates with us over the validity of video game nostalgia, online comment systems, and the sanctity of the Warthog.
item.description: Kotaku editor-in-chief Stephen Totilo debates with us over the validity of video game nostalgia, online comment systems, and the sanctity of the Warthog.

item.title: Ep. 11 - Big Head Mode with Adam Saltsman
item.itunes:subtitle: With apologies to Cliffy B.
item.itunes:summary: The Insert Credit Crew is joined by CANABALT creator Adam Saltsman to discuss the appeal of giant robots, to design a game for my old Nokia cell phone, and to play "Kill, Marry, Boff" Round 3.
item.description: The Insert Credit Crew is joined by CANABALT creator Adam Saltsman to discuss the appeal of giant robots, to design a game for my old Nokia cell phone, and to play "Kill, Marry, Boff" Round 3.

item.title: Ep. 12 - (#episodename)
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's get pretentious!
item.itunes:summary: Action Button Dot Net columnist and Music of the Spheres developer Hamish Todd makes a special appearance to discuss cosplay, surprise sequels, and high luncheon.
item.description: Action Button Dot Net columnist and Music of the Spheres developer Hamish Todd makes a special appearance to discuss cosplay, surprise sequels, and high luncheon.

item.title: Ep. 13 - Shave and a Haircut with Justin McElroy
item.itunes:subtitle: Starlight Magic
item.itunes:summary: Jaffe tries his best not to sound like a psychopath while the host of My Brother My Brother and Me podcast Justin McElroy chats with us about Sony's trophy system, games we got as gifts, and speed running.
item.description: Jaffe tries his best not to sound like a psychopath while the host of My Brother My Brother and Me podcast Justin McElroy chats with us about Sony's trophy system, games we got as gifts, and speed running.

item.title: Ep. 14 - Train Hard with Bennett Foddy
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes we kind of answer questions.
item.itunes:summary: QWOP creator Bennett Foddy joins us to talk about stuff. Stuff like Alan Moore, air dropping video games, and an actual Nintendo theme park.
item.description: QWOP creator Bennett Foddy joins us to talk about stuff. Stuff like Alan Moore, air dropping video games, and an actual Nintendo theme park.

item.title: Ep. 15 - Not Famous Anymore
item.itunes:subtitle: Recorded in 4-4 waluigi time.
item.itunes:summary: Christian Nutt returns by popular demand for discussion of up and coming game developers, the next career move for CliffyB, and promotional t-shirts.
item.description: Christian Nutt returns by popular demand for discussion of up and coming game developers, the next career move for CliffyB, and promotional t-shirts.

item.title: Ep. 16 - Jump on the Giant Chicken
item.itunes:subtitle: It's what the fans want.
item.itunes:summary: Gamasutra Editor in Chief Kris Graft shares his opinions on region locking, naming your characters, and the battle capabilities of Fat Princess.
item.description: Gamasutra Editor in Chief Kris Graft shares his opinions on region locking, naming your characters, and the battle capabilities of Fat Princess.

item.title: Ep. 17 - HALLOWEEN SPECDRACULAR
item.itunes:subtitle: FRIGHTS to meet you!

item.description: Vito Ghostualdi joins Frankenstein Cifaldi, The Grim Rogers, and that other guy to share spooky stories.

item.title: Ep. 18 - Gamesptoptp
item.itunes:subtitle: I'm coming, Elizabeth!

item.itunes:subtitle: Insert Credit Heart-to-Heart.

item.title: Ep. 20 - 9 Cent Convenience Fee
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen to these for the story.

item.description: Brandon's adventures in the Far East can only mean the return of Patrick Miller! Level editors, the Duckiverse, and swimsuit design are discussed.

item.title: Ep. 21 - Grim Fans Dango
item.itunes:subtitle: Really? Really!
item.itunes:summary: Did you miss our very first livestreamed podcast? Because even if you did, we have the meat of it ripped out right here, cured and salted for public consumption. Tim, Frank, Brandon and Patrick Miller discuss Skyrim with guns, Tim Schafer's fanbase, and the Fender Stratocaster.

item.itunes:subtitle: A total coincidence.

Questions this week:

  1. What would it take to get you actually excited about a new console? (05:10)
  2. This week an English fan translation was released for LSD dream emulator. What is this game and how do you play it? (11:55)
  3. Hideo Kojima fans often praise the themes for his games for their uncanny predictive powers. What makes his games so apparently prescient? (18:15)
  4. What are the qualities of a Valis-like? (24:28)
  5. Improv-zone. Frank, you are Nintendo of America president Doug Bowser at your first share holder meeting. You are desperately attempting to earn the faith of Tim and Brandon, who each suspect you be the actual King Bowser. (31:30)
  6. Patron question: What 2D game is closest to the Yakuza series? (39:42)
  7. What’s the best bootleg video game merchandise you’ve seen in the wild? (46:08)
  8. Have video games ever been worse for taking player feedback to heart? (52:41)
  9. What is the Olive Garden of video games? (58:45)
  10. If you were given unlimited funds to develop a video game, and you had to prove all the funds were being used on the video game, how would you exploit that resource to help as many people as possible? (1:04:30)

LIGHTING ROUND - SLOGAN SLINGING: I'm going to name a video game company and you have to pitch a new slogan for them. (1:08:30)

item.title: Ep. 133 - Doom Demon Plate Crash
item.itunes:subtitle: The Brain Kickstarter

Questions this week:

  1. Aging Video Game Stars
  2. The Legacy of the 2010s
  3. Video game preservation in the time of constant updates
  4. What are the hallmarks of a great video game trailer?
  5. The Adaptation Game: Bazooka Joe
  6. Alex C asks: Was Lost Planet 2 Proto-Destiny?
  7. Has anyone played any game they backed on Kickstarter?
  8. Podcasting Games
  9. Joke Weapons
  10. Most effective space-based games

LIGHTING ROUND: CRUNCH TIME
